Line 85: Line 85:
* '''MVids/MVidz''' (Music videos) - Can be ripped from TV, HDTV and DVDs.
* '''MVids/MVidz''' (Music videos) - Can be ripped from TV, HDTV and DVDs.
* '''NoCD'''/'''NoDVD'''/'''FixedExe''' - A file modification that allows an installed program to be run without inserting the CD or DVD into the drive.
* '''NoCD'''/'''NoDVD'''/'''FixedExe''' - A file modification that allows an installed program to be run without inserting the CD or DVD into the drive.
â
* '''Portables/Portablez''' - Similar to RIP, but refers to software or old/low size games (usually under 100 MB). The point of portable software is the fact that it can be placed on removable media and doesn't need installing; usually it is compressed into one executable file, by using software like [[VMware ThinApp]] or [[MoleBox]].
+
* '''[[Portable application|Portables/Portablez]]''' - Similar to RIP, but refers to software or old/low size games (usually under 100 MB). The point of portable software is the fact that it can be placed on removable media and doesn't need installing; usually it is compressed into one executable file, by using software like [[VMware ThinApp]] or [[MoleBox]].
* '''RIPs/RIPz''' - A variant of games/gamez that doesn't have to be installed, a registry entry can be included as a .reg file. RIP games can be ripped of music and/or video files, or, for console games, [[ROM Images|ROMs]], thus decreasing the size of the download.<ref>Software Piracy Exposed: How Software is Stolen and Traded Over the Internet - By Paul Craig, Ron Honick, Mark Burnett, Published by Syngress, 2005, ISBN 1932266984, Chapter 4 - Crackers, Pages 88â90 ([http://books.google.com/books?id=cA3qL9PBR0kC&pg=PA90&dq=warez+RIPs+games&sig=ACfU3U3FMMzELyiIRfCe1Brm9_YPb_ZTvw#PPA90,M1 View cited pages] using [[Google Books]])</ref> RIPs with nothing ripped out sometimes are referred to as DP (direct play).
* '''RIPs/RIPz''' - A variant of games/gamez that doesn't have to be installed, a registry entry can be included as a .reg file. RIP games can be ripped of music and/or video files, or, for console games, [[ROM Images|ROMs]], thus decreasing the size of the download.<ref>Software Piracy Exposed: How Software is Stolen and Traded Over the Internet - By Paul Craig, Ron Honick, Mark Burnett, Published by Syngress, 2005, ISBN 1932266984, Chapter 4 - Crackers, Pages 88â90 ([http://books.google.com/books?id=cA3qL9PBR0kC&pg=PA90&dq=warez+RIPs+games&sig=ACfU3U3FMMzELyiIRfCe1Brm9_YPb_ZTvw#PPA90,M1 View cited pages] using [[Google Books]])</ref> RIPs with nothing ripped out sometimes are referred to as DP (direct play).
* '''Scripts/Scriptz''' - [[Scripting language|Scripts]]: These include pirated commercial scripts (such as vBulletin, Invision Power Board, etc) coded by companies in [[PHP]], [[Active Server Pages|ASP]], and other languages.
* '''Scripts/Scriptz''' - [[Scripting language|Scripts]]: These include pirated commercial scripts (such as vBulletin, Invision Power Board, etc) coded by companies in [[PHP]], [[Active Server Pages|ASP]], and other languages.
